data.title: July
data.meta_description: 1983  The cavaliers make a Free Agent offer to Calvin Natt.
data.text:
July 1

1983

The cavaliers make a Free Agent offer to Calvin Natt.

1992

The Blazers traded Alaa Abdelnaby to the Milwaukee Bucks, receiving Tracy Murray from the San Antonio Spurs in a 3-team deal. Dale Ellis went from Bucks to Spurs to complete the deal. The Blazers also learned that Danny Ainge was going to sign with the Phoenix Suns. @alaatweets played 114 games w/#Blazers over 2 seasons after being 25th pick by @trailblazers in 1990 @NBADraft out of @DukeMBB. He played 5 seasons in the @NBA & an additional 5 seasons in Greece, France, and CBA. Currently, Alaa is an analyst for @sixers & @CBSSports

July 2

1998

​

The Blazers hired Brian Wheeler to be the Radio Voice of the Blazers, replacing legend Bill Schonely, who was reassigned to TV broadcasts following the 1998 playoffs. Wheeler was Voice of @WNBA #Monarchs prior to coming to Portland, where he broadcasted over 1800 games over the next 21 years.

July 3

The Blazers signed FA @rod_strickland after @danielrainge signed w/@suns then criticized @trailblazers front office for not taking his FA status seriously. "I gave Portland every opportunity to sign me" said Ainge, who played 2 seasons w/#Blazers.

​Strickland had played w/@spurs for last 2 1/2 seasons after being drafted by @nyknicks in 1988. Strickland would play 4 seasons w/#Blazers & have a 2nd stint during the 2001 season

July 4

July 5

1978

The Blazers traded Corky Calhoun to the Indiana Pacers to finish the trade the initially sent Johnny Davis to the Pacers for the 1st pick in the recent NBA draft. The Blazers selected Mychal Thompson with the pick. The Calhoun part of the deal was a 30-day window for Indiana to decide to have him be part of the deal, in exchange for a 2nd round pick in the 1980 draft.

July 6

2005

​The @trailblazers hired #NateMcMillan as 12th head coach. McMillan coached @SeattleSonics for 5 years but his contract expired July 1 & #Blazers pursued him to replace #MauriceCheeks & @PacersKev who combined for 27 wins in 04/05

July 7

HBD to former @trailblazers guard @uograd66 and center Rick Roberson

1971

The Blazers waived Shaler Halimon.

2016

Busy day in @trailblazers day as the team signed Free Agents #FestusEzeli & @thekidet. The #Blazers also signed @JLayman10 and@ShabazzNapier

July 9

Happy Birthday to former Blazer All-Star Jim Paxson.

July 10

1984

The @trailblazers rookie camp concluded with a tight, competitive game that ended on a last-second shot by rookie #SteveColter to give the White Team an 85-84 win against the Red Team in front of 3,071 fans.

Colter, a second round pick from @nmsu, finished with 20 points and earned a spot on the #Blazers#SummerLeague roster. #DanCaldwell of @UW added 16 more points and 10 rebounds for the White squad and will join Colter in #LosAngeles. #TonyBrown of @IUHoosiers led all scorers with 23 points, but was not invited to join the summer squad.

For the Red Team, @JeromeKersey25 from @longwoodu and #TimDunham of @SwordsMBB each scored 14 points and earned roster spots in Los Angeles as well. A surprise player to earn a run in the Summer League is #LanceBall who attended @WesternOregonU. Ball averaged 15.7 points and 9.6 rebounds for the #NAIA#Wolves.

2013 ​

A rather busy day as the @trailblazers added 5 players in 2 trades that involved 4 teams, a FA signing and a rookie signing.

In one deal, the #Blazers acquired @rolopez42 and @T_Harris87 in a trade that involved the @PelicansNBA and the @SacramentoKings. In the deal, #Portland sent the rights to @JeffWithey to #NewOrleans for two 2016 2nd round picks to the #Kings for the 2 players. More on that below.

In the 2nd trade, the Blazers acquired @Trobinson0 from the @HoustonRockets for the rights to #KostasPapanikolaou and #MarkoTodorović, as well as two future 2nd round picks. In addition, they signed FA @DWRIGHTWAY1 and rookie @allencrabbe, who Portland received in a Draft Day trade with the

@Cavs.

Interestingly, one of the picks the Blazers sent to the #SacramentoKings was traded just two later to the @Bucks, who used the pick to draft future Blazer point guard @MalcolmBrogdon7 in 2016.

2014

TRAIL BLAZERS SIGN GUARD STEVE BLAKE FOR THIRD TIME

​

PORTLAND, Ore. (July 10, 2014) – The Portland Trail Blazers have signed free agent guard Steve Blake, it was announced by General Manager Neil Olshey. Blake, 34, has averaged 6.9 points, 2.2 rebounds and 4.0 assists with Washington, Portland, Milwaukee, Denver, L.A. Clippers, L.A. Lakers and Golden State. “Steve is the consummate gamer,” said Olshey. “His natural leadership skills, ability to run a team and offensive skill set are a natural fit for our roster composition and style of play.”

Blake returns to the Trail Blazers for a third time during his NBA career after playing in Portland during the 2005-06 season and again from 2007-10. He signed with Portland as a free agent on each occasion, and was last traded from Portland on Feb. 16, 2010, in a deal that also sent Travis Outlaw to the Clippers in exchange for Marcus Camby.

In 269 games (232 starts) over four seasons with the Trail Blazers, Blake holds averages of 8.9 points, 2.3 rebounds and 4.7 assists. He notched career highs of 11.0 points per game and a 42.7 percent mark from 3-point range in 2008-09, his last full season with Portland. “Steve is the perfect fit for our team,” said Trail Blazers Head Coach Terry Stotts. “He brings experience, toughness, leadership, shooting and consistent defense. Steve will be a complement to our backcourt and provide mentorship for our young players.”

​Blake (6-3, 172) played four years at the University of Maryland and was selected by the Wizards with the ninth pick in the second round (38th overall) of the 2003 NBA Draft. Blake played a total of 350 games with the Blazers over 4 1/2 seasons total between 2005 to 2015. He scored 2747 points and passed for 1558 assists for Portland.

July 11

2007

An active day in the @trailblazers front office as the Blazers buyout #SteveFrancis contract as well as acquiring #JamesJones & @rudy5fernandez for $3 M from the @Suns. Francis was acquired along w/@channingfrye from @nyknicks for @MacBo50, @dandickau21 and@FredJones. The #Blazers bought out remaining 2 years of contract for a reported $30MJones played a single season w/#Blazers & 14 total in @NBA, winning 2 rings w/@MiamiHEAT. Fernandez played 3 seasons with #Blazers & is currently still playing w/@RMBaloncesto

July 12

1994

The @trailblazers hired Bob Whitsitt to be new President & GM. "Trader Bob" replaces Geoff Petrie, who resigned after #Blazers 93/94 season was completed.

July 13

July 14

1978

​

The movie #FoulPlay is released. Starring @goldiehawn & @ChevyChaseToGo, the movie is a romantic neo-noir comedy thriller film. In a particular scene, Hawn is visiting #BillyBarty at the hospital & in the background is @SInow edition w/@BillWalton & #LarrySteele

1985

​

The @trailblazers opened their Summer Rookie Camp w/18 players present. The evening games are open to public, concluding w/a Dunk Contest on July 17 w/current #Blazers@JeromeKersey25, #ClydeDrexler, & former Blazers #BillyRayBates & @mdhhoops expected

July 15

1977

The @trailblazers acquired former #Blazers center Dale Schlueter from @Suns for a 1978 4th round pick. Schlueter is the 1st Blazer player to return to team. While he was cut before the 1977/78 season began, Dale came back to finish out the season after injuries decimated the front line. He re-signed with team on March 25 and retired at conclusion of the regular season as he was not included on the playoff roster.

1996

The Blazers trade Rod Strickland and Harvey Grant to Washington Bullets for Rasheed Wallace.

July 17

July 17

July 19

1994

​

Bill Schonely and Eddie Doucette swap positions as Schonz moves back behind the radio mic, replacing Doucette, who moves to the TV side.

July 20

1991

​The Blazers 3rd annual Slam 'N Jam event was held to raise money for Ramon Ramos, who was injured in a car accident on Dec. 16, 1989. After music from the local band Perfect 10, a 3-point contest was held with Clyde Drexler, Terry Porter, Danny Ainge, and Terrell Brandon, the Univ. of Oregon player that was just drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers.

July 21

1990

​Drazen Petrovic scored 36 points in the 2nd annual Slam 'N Jam event.

July 25

July 28

1971

​Rick Adelman is named the first Captain in Blazers history. Adelman had a career year during the Blazers inaugural season, statistically speaking, scoring a career-high 1023 points and grabbing 282 rebounds, numbers he wouldn't top again. Adelman also passed for 380 assists, a career-high until the 1971/72 season when he passed for 413 assists.

July 30

1979

​Jack McKinney leaves to coach the Lakers

July 31

1972

The Blazers started the day with two former NBA Rookie-Of-The-Year Award winners and ended the day with a third. The Blazers acquired 6'5" forward Fred Foster from the Philadelphia 76ers for a 1973 2nd round draft pick and $5000 cash. Foster played 74 game with Philadelphia, where he averaged 11.9 points and 3.7 rebounds for the 76ers in the 1971/72 season. Instead of hoping a plane to Portland, Foster instead was traded by Portland to Detroit Pistons for Terry Dischinger, the player who won the NBA Rookie of the Year Award in the 1962–63 season. ​

Dischinger was the first pick of the second round (#8 overall) by the Chicago Zephyrs in the 1962 NBA draft and had an immediate impact in the NBA, as he averaged 25.5 points and 8.0 rebounds despite playing only 57 games. "During my rookie year I wanted to obtain my Chemical Engineering degree from Purdue, so Chicago let me attend school and play on weekends and holidays." Dischinger recalled. "One time after class I left Purdue at 4 PM, taped my ankles in a cab and played that night in San Francisco. It wasn't that tough of a year because I received my degree, the rookie of the year award, and was paid to play the game I loved." Dischinger was named rookie of the year over four future Hall of Famers, whom he joined on the 1962–63 NBA All-Rookie Team: Zelmo Beaty, Dave DeBusschere, John Havlicek and Chet Walker.

After his rookie season the Zephyrs moved to Baltimore, Maryland and became the Baltimore Bullets (today's Washington Wizards). In his second season, Dischinger averaged 20.8 points and 8.3 rebounds as Baltimore finished 31–49 under Hall of Fame Coach Leonard. Dischinger playing alongside future Hall of Famers Walt Bellamy and Rod Thorn, as well as Kevin Loughery, Gene Shue and Sihugo Green.

Dischinger attended Purdue University in West Lafayette, Indiana from 1959 to 1962, where he was also a member of the 1960 USA men's basketball team that won the gold medal at the 1960 Rome Olympics under head coach Pete Newell. Dischinger, who was 19 years old and finishing his sophomore year of college, was the youngest member of the team. As a starting guard/forward, he was teamed with future Basketball Hall of FamersOscar Robertson, Jerry West, and Jerry Lucas. The team was named to the Naismith Basketball Hall of Fame in 2010. He started all 8 games, scoring 90 total points, with an 11.3 points-per-game average as the fourth-leading scorer on the team. "It was a fairy tale because I played with my idol, Oscar Robertson. The experience made me a much better player." said Dischinger.

Dischinger retired after his single season in Portland and attended dental school in Memphis Tennessee. Following his completion of school in Tennessee, Dischinger returned to Portland and begin an orthodontic practice in Lake Oswego. My younger son Brennen was seen by Dr. Dischinger in the early 90's after he lost his front tooth due to an accident with a swing set. My wife Shellie was unaware of who the dentist was initially but filled me in on his office when she returned home. A video of his office can be seen at the link below.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6BSmCBNgJn8
